questions.question: A sum of BDT 200 will be divided among 5 swimmers, named Emran, Durjoy, Chopol, Billal and Anabi, who have just finished a swimming competition. Everyone will receive at least BDT 5 and no two swimmers will receive the same amount of money. Emran has come 1 st  1^{\text {st }} 1 st  and will get BDT 80; Durjoy has come 2 nd  2^{\text {nd }} 2 nd  , Chopol is 3 rd  3^{\text {rd }} 3 rd  , Billal is 4 th  4^{\text {th }} 4 th  and Anabi is last. Moreover, the distribution of money is subject to the following conditions: • No one will get any fractional amount of money. • The swimmer who finishes earlier must receive more money than the swimmer(s) he defeats.. What are the greatest and least amount of money, consecutively, that Chopol can receive?
questions.explanation: Chopol is 3 rd  3^{\text {rd }} 3 rd  . So, Durjoy has to get more money than Chopol. Giving Anabi 5 and Billal 6 , the remaining 109 BDT can be distributed between Durjoy and Chopol as 55 and 54 BDT, respectively. So, the most Chopol can get is 54 BDT. For the least amount Chopol can get, firstly, Durjoy can get at most 79 BDT. That leaves 41 BDT where Chopol has to get more than Anabi and Bilal. So, numbers close to an arithmetic series will give the least amount for Chopol. The series will close to 41 / 3 ≈ 14 41 / 3 \approx 14 41/3 ≈ 14 . The required series that meets the conditions is 15 , 14 , 12 15,14,12 15 , 14 , 12 . So, the least amount Chopol can get is 15 .

To get the least amount for Durjoy, we need to maximize the amount the other 3 can get. The series that meets the required conditions is 32 , 31 , 30 , 27 32,31,30,27 32 , 31 , 30 , 27 . Here, the amount Durjoy will get is 32. If we try to decrease this amount then the numbers will be repeated. So, the least amount of money Durjoy can get is 32 .

It emphasizes that: Domestication of plants and animals may not have been entirely “monumental” or “groundbreaking” as previously claimed. Increased leisure time is not clearly shown to be a benefit. The full impact of the revolution has not been properly documented. Option Analysis ক — Greater leisure time is not beneficial for Homo Sapiens. Aligns with the passage’s critique of overstatements, but this is more interpretive . The safest, explicitly stated fact is option ঘ. ⚠ Could be partly correct, but less directly stated. questions.question: Instructions: Read the following passage and select the best answer for each of the questions that follow. Most educated people of the eighteenth century, such as the Founding Fathers, subscribed to Natural Rights Theory, the idea that every human being has a considerable number of innate rights, simply by virtue of being a human being when the US Constitution was sent to the states for ratification, many at that time felt that the federal government outlined by the constitution would be too strong, and that rights of individual citizens against the government had to be clarified. This led to the Bill of Right, the first ten amendments, which were ratified at he same time as the Constitution. The first eight of these amendments list specific rights of citizens. Some leaders feared that listing some rights could be interpreted to mean that citizens didn't have other, unlisted rights. Toward this end, James Madison and others produced the Ninth Amendment, which states; the fact that certain rights are listed in the Constitution shall not be construed to imply that other rights of the people are denied. Constitutional traditionalists interpret the Ninth Amendment as a rule for reading the rest of the constitution. They would argue that "Ninth Amendment rights" are a misconceived notion: the amendment does not, by itself, create federally enforceable rights. In particular, this strict reasoning would be opposed to the creation of any new rights based on the amendment. Rather, according to this view, the amendment merely protects those rights that citizens already have, whether they are explicitly listed in the Constitution or simply implicit in people's lives and in American tradition. More liberal interpreters of the US Constitution have a much more expansive view of the Ninth Amendment. In their view, the Ninth Amendment guarantees to American citizens a vast universe of potential rights, some of which we have enjoyed for two centuries, and others that the Founding Fathers could not possibly have conceived. These scholars point out that some rights, such as voting rights of women or minorities, were not necessarily viewed as rights by the majority of citizens in late eighteenth century America, but are taken as fundamental and unquestionable in modern America. While those rights cited are protected specifically by other amendments and laws, the argument asserts that other unlisted rights also could evolve from unthinkable to perfectly acceptable, and the Ninth Amendment would protect these as-yet-undefined rights. Constitutional scholars of both the traditionalist and liberal views would agree that 'Ninth Amendment rights".....

options.label: ক
options.text: accommodate shifts in cultural values with respect to issues affecting human rights

options.label: খ
options.text: cannot serve as the basis of legal decisions

options.label: গ
options.text: are directly reflected in our understanding of who can and can't vote

options.label: ঘ
options.text: are not stated explicitly in the Bill of Rights

questions.question: Read the following excerpt and answer the next 5 questions below: Despite a long-term decline in the circus industry, Cirque du Soleil profitably increased revenue 22-fold over the last ten years by reinventing the circus. Rather than competing within the confines of the existing industry or trying to steal customers from rivals, Cirque developed uncontested market space that made the competition irrelevant. Cirque created what is called a blue ocean, a previously unknown market space. In blue oceans, demand is created rather than fought over. There is ample opportunity for growth that is both profitable and rapid. In red oceans existing companies in the industry compete to grab a greater share of limited demand. As the market space gets more crowded, prospects for profits and growth decline. Products turn into commodities, and increasing competition turns the water bloody. There are two ways to create blue oceans. One is to launch completely new industries, as eBay did with online auctions. But it's much more common for a blue ocean to be created from within a red ocean when a company expands the boundaries of an existing industry. A blue ocean strategy encourages companies to focus less on their competitors and more on alternatives, while at the same time focusing less on their current customers and more on potential new customers. While competitive strategy would advise companies to enter attractive industries and avoid unattractive ones, blue oceans can be created in any industries, be they attractive or unattractive, stagnant or fast growing, high tech or low tech. It is all about creating new market space rather than letting the existing market structure confine strategic choices. Creating blue oceans builds brands. Along with Cirque, Southwest Airlines offers an example of successful blue ocean strategy execution. Southwest tapped into a customer base who preferred driving to air travel due to the lower cost. Instead of competing with other airlines, Southwest positioned itself as an alternative to cars and offered reduced prices, improved check-in times and increased flight frequency. Winners in a blue ocean strategy like Southwest, use 'value innovation' to drive their strategy. However, a blue ocean strategy is inherently disruptive and that makes it far riskier than a red ocean strategy. The primary purpose of the passage is to:

questions.question: Three workers P. Q. R can do a certain job at their own rate separately. If X represents the ratio of the work-speed of P and R, and Y represents the ratio of the work-speed of Q and R. such that X<Y and Y<1, who is the fastest worker of the three?
questions.explanation: We know that the absolute (পরম মান) of a fraction (ভগ্নাংশ) depends on the difference of value of the numerator and the denominator. If the value of the numerator is smaller than the denominator, then the fraction will have a value that will be less than 1, and if the value of the numerator is greater than the value of the denominator, then the value of the fraction will be greater than 1. This concept can be applied to this problem. X represents the ratio of work-speed of P and R, which is, X=P/R. Y represents the ratio of work-speed of Q and R, which is, Y=Q/R. Given that, X<Y and Y<1, therefore, the value of both X and Y are less than 1 and greater than 0, since working speed cannot be negative. Since in both the fractions, the value is less than 1 and they have the common denominator R, we can say that the work speed of R is clearly greater than that of P or Q.

questions.question: Abdul buys 40 pens at the market price of 36 pens from a wholesaler. If he sells these pens giving a discount of 1% on market price, what is the percentage of profit?
questions.explanation: Suppose, the market price of 1 pen is 100. Cost Price of 40 pens = 36 x 100 = 3600 Selling price of 40 pens with 1% discount on market price = 40 x 99 = 3960 Profit 3960-3600 = 360 Percentage of profit = (360/3600) x 100% = 10%.

questions.question: A rectangular field is to be fenced on three sides leaving a side of 10 feet uncovered. If the area of the field is 240 square feet, how many feet of fencing will be required?
questions.explanation: Area of the rectangular field is 240 sq. ft. One side of 10 feet is to be left uncovered. So, the field has a side equal to 240/10 =24 ft. Required feet of fencing = 24 +10 +24 = 58.

questions.question: A tank currently holds 60 liters of water. If 30 liters of water is added to the tank when it is half full of water, the amount of water in the tank increases by 1/3. What is the maximum water holding capacity of the tank?

This means 1/3 of half of the tank is 30 liters. So half of the tank is 90 liters. So the maximum water holding capacity of the tank is 180 liters.

questions.question: This year Rana will save certain amount of his income, and he will spend the rest. If he wants his next year's spending to be half of this year's spending, Y x (1 + r) = X/2 so, Y = X/(2 + 2г). So fraction of his income to be saved this year = Y/(X + Y) = {X/(2+2r)}/{X+X/(2 + 2r)) = 1/(2r + 3)

questions.question: A certain test consists of 8 sections with 25 questions numbered from 1 to 25, in each section. If a student answered all of the even-numbered questions correctly and ¼ of the odd numbered questions correctly, what was the total number of questions he answered correctly?

questions.question: In dividing a number by 585, a student employed the method of short division. He divided the number successively by 5, 9 and 13 (factors of 585) and got the remainders 4, 8, 12 respectively. If he had divided the number by 585, what would have been the remainder?
questions.explanation: 5, 9 এবং 13 র L.C.M. = 585. The common difference between divisors 5, 9 and 13, and their respective remainders 4, 8 and 12 is 1. So, the least number can be L.C.M of 5, 9 and 13 minus the common difference = 585-1 = 584. সুতরাং, বলা যাই উক্ত সংখ্যা কে 585 দ্বারা ভাগ করলে ভাগশেষ থাকবে 584.

questions.question: Identify the sentence(s) that is/are showing the correct use of the word in questions. The word: PRIOR i. We're sorry to reject your candidature. You do have prior experience; it's just not relevant to the job! ii. I can clearly discern your personal preference for the first alternative, but if you look objectively, you'd see there's no a prior reason to favour one alternative over the other. iii. The patient, priorly known for his delusional tendencies, was admitted right away.
questions.explanation: Sentence i: "You do have prior experience; it's just not relevant to the job!" ✅ Correct. “Prior” is correctly used as an adjective meaning “earlier” or “previous.” Sentence ii: "…there's no a prior reason to favour one alternative over the other." ❌ Incorrect. The phrase “a prior reason” is awkward here. Normally, you would say “no reason” or “no prior reason” , but adding “a” makes it grammatically wrong. Sentence iii: "The patient, priorly known for his delusional tendencies, was admitted right away." ✅ Correct. “Priorly” is the adverb form of prior and is used correctly to modify known . Correct answer: গ) both i and iii

questions.question: Abbas is heavier than Bobby, but is lighter than Reza. Shabbir is heavier than both Bobby and Reza. Omar is heavier than both Bobby and Reza. If the statements are true, one can conclude with certainty that Dipu is heavier than Abbas if one knows in addition that-

options.label: ক
options.text: Shabbir weighs the same as Omar weighs

questions.option_a: Shabbir weighs the same as Omar weighs
questions.explanation: Let's analyze the given information: Abbas > Bobby but Abbas < Reza → so Bobby < Abbas < Reza . Shabbir > Bobby and Shabbir > Reza → Shabbir is heavier than both. Omar > Bobby and Omar > Reza → Omar is also heavier than both. We are asked: Under what additional information can we conclude with certainty that Dipu > Abbas? Knowing Dipu > Bobby alone is not enough , because Abbas could still be heavier than Dipu (we don’t know Reza’s and Dipu’s relative weights). Knowing Dipu > Omar or Shabbir > Dipu doesn’t necessarily place Dipu above Abbas either. The only way to conclude Dipu > Abbas is if we know Dipu is heavier than someone who is heavier than Abbas . Looking at the options: Option গ: Dipu is heavier than Bobby → Not enough, because Abbas > Bobby. Option ঘ: Dipu is heavier than Omar → Omar could be heavier than Abbas, but we need certainty. Option খ: Shabbir is heavier than Dipu → Not enough, tells nothing about Abbas. Option ক: Shabbir weighs the same as Omar → Irrelevant. ✅ So the correct choice is ঙ: None of these .

questions.question: A company sells packages of decorative papers, each containing three sheets of paper. The available colors are: red, orange, green, blue, and purple. Each package must conform to the following rules: Each package must contain sheets of either two or three different colors. A package containing any orange sheet must also contain at least one red sheet. A package containing any red sheet must also contain at least one orange sheet. Blue and purple sheets cannot be packed in the same package. A package containing any green sheet must also contain at least one purple sheet, but a package containing purple sheet need not contain green sheet. An acceptable package CANNOT contain two sheets of-
questions.explanation: Each package must contain sheets of either two or three different colors. ✅ Orange ↔ Red dependency: Any orange sheet ⇒ at least one red sheet. Any red sheet ⇒ at least one orange sheet. So, red and orange must appear together if either is included. Blue and purple sheets cannot be together. ❌ Green → Purple dependency: Any green sheet ⇒ at least one purple sheet. Purple sheet does not require green. Now, the question asks: “An acceptable package CANNOT contain two sheets of–” We need to check which color cannot have two sheets in the same package . Red & Orange: Must appear together if included, but nothing prohibits having two reds or two oranges . ✅ Possible. Blue & Purple: Cannot be together; two of the same color is not prohibited. ✅ Possible. Green & Purple: Green requires purple, but nothing prohibits two greens . ✅ Possible. The trick is with orange and red : since red ↔ orange dependency exists, having two oranges but no red would violate the rule. Similarly, two reds but no orange would also violate the rule. Thus, you cannot have two sheets of Orange or Red alone . ✅ The best answer from the options is: ক – Orange .

If the trader makes a profit of Tk. 2000, how much yellow paint (in kgs) did he use in the mixture?
questions.explanation: ধরে নিই, আমাদের ক্রেতা কিনলেন 1 liter নীল আর 2 liters হলুদ পেইন্ট । খরচ = 110 + (100 × 2 ) = 310 Tk বলা আছে প্রস্তুতকৃত সবুজ পেইন্ট বিক্রি করা হয় 120 Tk. প্রতি liter. সুতরাং, 3 liter সবুজ পেইন্ট এর বিক্রয় মূল্য = 3 x 120 = 360 Tk .. লাভ= 50 Tk. এখন, 50 Tk লাভ করতে ব্যবহার করতে হয় 2 kg হলুদ পেইন্ট :: 1 Tk লাভ করতে ব্যবহার করতে হবে 2/50kg হলুদ পেইন্ট। .: 2000 TK লাভ করতে ব্যবহার করতে হবে 2 × 2000 50 = 80 \frac{2 \times 2000}{50}=80 50 2 × 2000 ​ = 80 = 80kg হলুদ পেইন্ট ।

questions.question: A ship with a faulty engine sailed for only 7 hours over a period of 2 days and covered a distance of 59 km. Its average speed on the first day was 5 km per hour slower than that on the second day. But it sailed 3 hours longer on the first day than that on the second day. What was its average speed on the second day?
questions.explanation: ধরে নিই, দ্বিতীয় দিন এর avg. speed ছিল x ∴ প্রথম দিন এর avg. speed ছিল x- 5 ধরে নিলাম, জাহাজ কি দ্বিতীয় দিন এ t hours ধরে চলছে, ∴ প্রথম দিন t+3 hours চলছে। বলা আছে, t + t +3 = 7 ⇒ 2t = 4, t = 2, t+3 = 5 আমরা জানি, speed = distance / time, distance speed x time সুতরাং, 2x + 5 (x - 5) = 59 →7x=84 ⇒ x = 12

questions.question: When the integer n is divided by 3, the quotient is p and the remainder is 1. When p is divided by 5, the quotient is q and the remainder is 2. What will be the remainder when n is divided by 5?
questions.explanation: বলা আছে, n কে 3 দিয়ে ভাগ করলে ভাগফল হয় p এবং ভাগশেষ হয় 1। সুতরাং, n = 3p + 1 যখন p কে 5 দ্বারা ভাগ করা হয়, ভাগফল হয় q আর ভাগশেষ হয় 2। সুতরাং, p = 5q + 2 ∴ n = 3(5q + 2) + 1 = 15q + 7 যেহেতু 15q + 5 কে 5 দ্বারা ভাগ করা যায়, 15q + 7 এর অবশ্যই 2 ভাগশেষ থাকতে হবে।

The important point is that many major social advances have been made on the basis of life forms whose worth would never have been perceived in advance. Consider the impact of rubber-producing plants on contemporary life and industry: approximately two-thirds of the world's rubber supply come from rubber-producing plants and is made into objects as diverse as rubber washers and rubber boots. Any of the following facts could be used as illustrative examples in addition to the example of rubber-producing plants EXCEPT-

options.label: ক
options.text: The discovery of the vaccine for smallpox resulted from observing the effect of the cowpox virus on the hands of dairy workers.

options.label: খ
options.text: The major source of our pharmaceutical supplies is plants, some of them commonly thought of as weeds.

options.label: গ
options.text: Certain antibiotics were originally derived, from mold growing on cantaloupes

options.label: ঘ
options.text: Plastic is a unique product derived from petroleum and petroleum by-products.

questions.question: It is a bright sunny day and the last Cricket match of Micromax GDI series between Bangladesh had New Zealand is about to begin. questions.question: In "RIGHT ON TIME" courier service, during an autumn day, a courier has to deliver six packages Hurricane, Torpedo, Cyclone, Tornado, Typhoon, and Thunder. He delivers no other packages, and no two packages are delivered at the same time. The order in which the packages are delivered conforms to the following conditions: Hurricane is neither delivered first nor delivered last. Cyclone is delivered before Tornado is delivered. questions.explanation: ছয়টি package (Hurricane, Torpedo, Cyclone, Tornado, Typhoon ও Thunder) deliver করতে হবে নিচের শর্তানুযায়ী- a. দু'টি package একসাথে deliver করা যাবেনা। b. questions.question: Read the following passage and select the best answer for each of the questions of that follow. National character is not formally considered by social scientists in discussing economic and social development today. They believe that people differ, and that these difference should be taken into account somehow, but they have as yet discovered no way to include such variables in their formal models of economic and social development. The difficulty lies in the nature of the data that supposedly define different national characteristics. Anthropologists and others are on much firmer ground when they attempt to describe the cultural norms for a small homogeneous tribe or village than when they undertake the formidable task of discovering the norms that exist in a complex modern nation-state composed of many disparate groups. The situation is further complicated by the nature of judgments about characters since such judgments are overly dependent on impressions, and since, furthermore, impressions are usually stated in qualitative terms, it is impossible to make a reliable comparison between the national characters of two countries. It can be inferred from the passage that the social scientists mentioned in lines 1-4 would agree with which of the following statements? I. It is extremely difficult to create models that account for both economic and social development. II. Models of economic and social development would be improved by the inclusion of adequate descriptions of national character. III. It is important to supplement formal models of economic and social development with qualitative impressions of national character.
questions.explanation: 1) হবে না কারণ Economic and Social Development এর model তৈরি কঠিন কি না তা বলা হয় নি। (III) Qualitative impressions ব্যবহার করলে model complicated হয়ে যাবে। শুধু || সত্য। এ জন্য answer B.

questions.question: Read the following passage and select the best answer for each of the questions that follow. The Earth's magnetic field is generated as the molten iron of the Earth's outer core revolves around its solid inner core. When surges in the molten iron occur, magnetic tempests are created. At the Earth's surface, these tempests can be detected by changes in the strength of the Earth's magnetic field. For reasons not fully understood, the field itself reverses periodically every million years or so. During the past million years, for instance, the magnetic north pole has migrated between the Antarctic and the Arctic. Clearly, geophysicists who seek to explain and forecast changes in the field must understand what happens in the outer core. Unlike meteorologists, however, they cannot rely on observations made in their own lifetimes. Whereas atmospheric storms arise in a matter of hours and last for days, magnetic tempests develop over decades and persist for centuries. Fortunately, scientists have been recording changes in the Earth's magnetic field for more than 300 years. The passage suggests which of the following about surges in the Earth's

options.label: ক
options.text: They occur cyclically every few decades.

options.label: খ
options.text: They can be predicted by changes in the Earth's inner core.

options.label: গ
options.text: They are detected through indirect means.

options.label: ঘ
options.text: They are linked to disturbances in the Earth's atmosphere.

questions.option_a: They occur cyclically every few decades.
questions.option_b: They can be predicted by changes in the Earth's inner core.
questions.option_c: They are detected through indirect means.
questions.option_d: They are linked to disturbances in the Earth's atmosphere.
questions.explanation: passage শুরুর তিনটি লাইন (Especially 3rd) suggest করে, Inner core এর molted iron এর revolution (ঘূর্নন) এর ফলে outer core এর surge সংগঠিত হয়।

Rashed ও Sakib এর articles একই magazine এ published হতে পারবেনা। 3. কোন magazine এ Arshad এর article published হলে Behroz এর article ও published হতে হবে। 4. কোন magazine এ Emon এর article published হলে Rashed এর article তার immediate আগের magazine এ published হতে হবে। 5. কোন author এর article পরপর দুটি magazine এ বা একই magazine এ দুবার published হতে পারবেনা। Condition 4 অনুসারে, Emon এর article published হতে গেলে তার আগের period এ Rashed এর article published হতে হবে। যেহেতু January publication এ Rashed এর article নেই, April publication এ Emon এর article থাকতে পারবেনা [Option (C) and (D)]. অতএব, Emon এর article August publication এ হতেই হবে যার ফলে April publication এ Rashed এর article থাকতেই হবে [Condition 4] যার কারণে Option (B) answer হবেনা। যেহেতু Option (a) কোন condition violate.

questions.question: Exactly six RAB officers - S, T, U, X, Y, and Z- take turns watching a suspect. To minimize the chance that the suspect will observe them or will escape their surveillance, the officers will operate according to the following conditions: There must be exactly two officers watching the suspect at all times. Whenever the suspect travels by car, either U or X must be one of the two officers watching, but U and X cannot take a turn together. Whenever the suspect travels by train, either Tor Z must be one of the two officers watching, but T and Z cannot take a turn together. If Z is one of the officers watching the suspect, S must be the other officer watching the suspect. S and X cannot take a turn together watching the suspect. If a pair of officers was watching while the suspect traveled by car, and the same pair of officers continued watching after the suspect began to travel by train, one member of that pair of officers must have been
questions.explanation: এই puzzle টির condition গুলো হল: Exactly 2টি officer কে suspect watch করতে হবে। Suspect যদি car এ travel করে, U অথবা X কে watch করতে হবে, কিন্তু 2- জনই একসাথে watch করতে পারবেনা। Suspect যদি train এ travel করে, T অথবা Z কে watch করতে হবে, কিন্তু 2- জনই একসাথে watch করতে পারবেনা। Z থাকলে S কেও থাকতে হবে। S এবং X একসাথে watch করতে পারবেন। যেহেতু officer দুজন train এ suspect কে watch করে, তাদের মাঝে একজনকে অবশ্যই T অথবা Z হতে হবে [Condition 3]. যদি Z কে select করা হয়, অন্য partner টিকে অবশ্যই S হতে হবে [Condition 5]. কিন্তু Z ও S কখনোই car এ suspect কে watch করতে পারবেনা because it violates Condition 2. Therefore, one of the officers must be T.

questions.explanation: এই puzzle টির condition গুলো হল: Exactly 2টি officer কে suspect watch করতে হবে। Suspect যদি car এ travel করে, U অথবা X কে watch করতে হবে, কিন্তু 2- জনই একসাথে watch করতে পারবেনা। Suspect যদি train এ travel করে, T অথবা Z কে watch করতে হবে, কিন্তু 2- জনই একসাথে watch করতে পারবেনা। Z থাকলে S কেও থাকতে হবে। S এবং X একসাথে watch করতে পারবেন। Condition 4 থেকে আমরা জানি, Z suspect-কে watch করলে S কেও করতে হবে। Therefore, Z এর partner কখনোই Y হতে পারবেনা।

questions.question: The side AB of triangle ABC is divided at D in the ratio 3:4. DE is parallel to BC and DF is parallel to AC. DE = 15 cm and DF = 16cm. Find the length of AC in cm.
questions.explanation: যেহেতু, DE is parallel to BC এবং DF is parallel to AC, DECF একটি parallelogram. DF = CE = 16. Moreover, ADE and ABC are similar triangles. Therefore, AB/BD = AC/CE = 7/4. As a result, AC = (AB/BD) x CE = 7/4 x 16 = 28.

questions.question: The ratio of marbles owned by X and Y is 8:3. If X gives 8 marbles to Y, the ratio becomes 6:5. How many marbles does X have?
questions.explanation: মনে করি, X ও Y এর কাছে marble আছে যথাক্রমে 8x ও 3x টি। প্রশ্নমতে, (8x-8)/(3x + 8) = 6/5 40x40= 18x + 48 ⇒ x = 4 Therefore, X has (8 x 4) or 32 marbles.

questions.question: x = y - (50/y), where x and y are both positive numbers. If the value of y is doubled, the value of x will.
questions.explanation: y কে double করা হলে x এর নতুন value হয় 2y (50/2y) = 2y 25/y. যেহেতু এই expression টির positive part টি doubled হয় এবং negative part টি halved হয় x এর value will increase to more than double. For example, যদি y = 25 হয় x = 25 (50/25) = 23. Y কে double করা হলে x এর নতুন value হয় = 50 (50/50) = 49 which is more than double of 23, the previous value of x.

questions.question: The price of sugar has increased by 32%. A family reduces its consumption so that the expenditure of sugar is up by 10% only. If the total consumption of sugar before the price rise was 10 kg per month, what is the current consumption of sugar per month (in kg)?
questions.explanation: মনে করি, previous price of sugar = Tk. 100 per kg. 32% বৃদ্ধি পাবার পরে price হয়= Tk. 132. Previous consumption of sugar was 10 kg. Therefore, previous expense = 100 x 10 = Tk. 1000. Current expenditure কে 10% বৃদ্ধিতে আবদ্ধ করতে গেলে তা হবে= 1000 x 1.1 = 1,100. Therefore, current consumption = 1,100/132 = 8.33 kg.

questions.question: In Hotel Sea View, the daily rate for an economic room, which can accommodate a maximum of four people, is Taka 800 for one person and Taka X for each additional person. If 3 friends take the room for one day and each pays Taka. 450 for the room, what is the value of X?
questions.explanation: প্রশ্নানুসারে, first person Tk. 800 এবং additional 2টি people 'X' করে দিলে total rent = 800 + 2X. আবার, প্রত্যেক Tk. 450 করে দিলে total rent = 450 x 3 = Tk. 1350. Now, 800 + 2X = 1350; Therefore, X = Tk. 275.

questions.question: In a recent survey among 362 BBA students of IBA, 281 students responded that they watch IPL or English Premier League or both. If 97 of these students do not watch IPL and a total of 204 students watch English Premier League, how many of these students watch both?

Step 1: Break down the EPL watchers Total EPL watchers = 204 Among them, students who do NOT watch IPL = 97 So: Both=204−97=107\text{Both} = 204 - 97 = 107Both=204−97=107 Step 2: Verify consistency with total group To check correctness: EPL only = 97 Both = 107 So IPL only = 281 − (97 + 107) =281−204=77= 281 - 204 = 77=281−204=77 All numbers are valid (none negative). Total IPL watchers = IPL only + Both = 77 + 107 = 184 (reasonable). So the question is correct and consistent. Correct Answer: 107 students watch both. But 107 is NOT in the answer choices (12, 14, 18, 20, None of these). Therefore: Correct option: ঙ (None of these)

questions.question: If y = (3x-6)/x, then for what values of x, y will always be positive?
questions.explanation: (3x-6)/x > 0 y কে positive হতে গেলে এখানে either (3x-6) এবং x দুটোকেই positive অথবা দুটোকেই negative হতে হবে। If 3x - 6 > 0, x > 2 and x > 0. এই দুটোর মাঝে common relation টি নিলে আমরা পাই x > 2. On the other hand, if 3x-6 <0, x<2 and x < 0. এই দুটোর মাঝে common relation টি নিলে আমরা পাই x < 0. Therefore, either x > 2 or x < 0.

questions.question: A CD player and a DVD player have the same price. If the price of the CD player goes up by 10% and that of the DVD player is decreased by 5%, how much more will it cost to buy 5 CD players and 5 DVD players?
questions.explanation: মনে করি, আগে প্রত্যেকটি CD player and DVD player এর price ছিলো = Tk. 10. অতএব, 5টি CD Player ও 5টি DVD Player এর দাম ছিলো = Tk. 100 এখন CD Player এর দাম বেড়ে হয় =10 x 1.10 =Tk. 11 এবং DVD Player এর দাম বেড়ে হয় =10x0.95=Tk. 9.5 অতএব, 5টি CD Player ও 5টি DVD Player এর দাম হয় = 5 x 11 + 5 x 9.5 = Tk. 102.5 Increase in price = 2.5%

questions.question: A company rents parking spaces at the rate of Tk. 100 per week or Tk. 300 per month. How much does a person save in a year (in Taka) by renting by month rather than by week?
questions.explanation: Per week rent করলে 1 Year (52 weeks) এ খরচ হয়= 52 x 100 = Tk. 5200 Per nionth rent করলে 1 Year (12 months) এ খরচ হয় = 12 x 300 = Tk. 3600 Therefore, savings = 5200-3600 = 1600.

questions.question: An employee can choose one of two methods of annual payment either an annual salary of Tk. 35,000 with no commission or an annual salary of Tk. 10,000 plus a 20% commission on her annual sales. What must be her total annual sales to get the same annual payment in either method?
questions.explanation: মনে করি, salary 'x' হলে 2টি method এই annual payment same হবে। অতএব, 35,000 = 10,000 + 0.2x 0.2x = 25,000 ⇒ x = 125,000

questions.question: X and Y are positive integers. If 5X is the square of a number and 75XY is the cube of another number, what is the smallest value for X + Y?
questions.explanation: 5X যদি একটি number এর square হয়, X এর minimum value 5 হতে হবে। In that case, 75XY = 5 x 5 x 5 x 3 x Y হবে। যেহেতু, প্রশ্নে বলা আছে যে, 75XY একটি সংখ্যার cube, Y এর minimum value হবে = 3 x 3 = 9. অতএব, X + Y এর minimum value = 5 + 9 = 14.

questions.question: Alam can do a job in 3 hours. BIPU can do the same work in 20% lesser time but he charges 30% per hour more than Alam does. Alam works for 1 hour and the rest is completed by Bipu. If Alam receives Tk. 100, how much did Bipu receive?
questions.explanation: Alam পুরো কাজটি করে 3 hours এ। এর মাঝে সে 1 hour এর কাজ করে ফেলে এবং বাকি কাজ করতে তার লাগবে 2 hours. Bipu Alam- এর থেকে 20% কম সময়ে কাজ করতে পারে। অতএব, বাকি কাজটি করতে Bipu- এর সময় লাগবে = 2 x (100-20)/100 = 1.6 hours. Alam প্রতি hour কাজ করার জন্য পায় 100 taka. যেহেতু Bipu Alam- এর থেকে 30% বেশী charge করে, Bipu per hour পাবে 100 + 100 x 30/100 = 130 Taka. Therefore, Bipu will receive = 1.6 x 130 Tk. 208.

questions.question: Last year Mrs. Shahana received Tk. 160 in dividends on her shares in Company X stock If she had 15 more shares of the stock last year, she would have received Tk. 25 more in total dividends. How many shares of the stock did she have last year?
questions.explanation: 15 টি share বেশী থাকলে dividend Tk. 25 বেশী হোতো। যেহেতু Tk. 25 dividend পাওয়া যায় 15 টি share এ, Tk. 160 dividend পাওয়া যায় = 160 x 15/25 = 96 টি share এ।

questions.question: If m is an even integer and n is an integer (either odd or even), then which of the following will always be even? i. m² + n² + n ii. (m-n) x (n + 1) iii. m²- n² + 1
questions.explanation: দেয়া আছে, m একটি even integer এবং n একটি integer (even বা odd দুটিই হতে পারে) i. n যদি even হয়, m² + n² + n = (Even)² + (Even)² + Even = Even n যদি odd হয়, m² + n² + n = (Even)² + (Odd)² + Odd = = Even + Odd + Odd = Even ii. n যদি even হয়, (m-n) x (n + 1) = (Even - Even) x (Even + 1) = Even x Odd = Even n যদি odd হয়, (m-n) x (n + 1) = (Even - Odd) x (Odd + 1) = Odd x Even = Even iii. n যদি even হয়, m²-n² + 1 = (Even)² - (Even)² + Odd = Odd n যদি odd হয়, m²-n² + 1 = (Even)² - (Odd)² + Odd = Even - Odd + Odd = Even শুধুমাত্র statement i 2 and ii ই সবসময় even হয়.

questions.question: An amount of money is to be distributed among P, Q and R in the ratio of 6:19:7 respectively. If R gives Tk. 200 of his share to Q. the ratio among P, Q and R becomes 3:10:3 respectively. What was the total amount in taka?
questions.explanation: মনে করি, শুরুতে P, Q এবং R এর কাছে যথাক্রমে 6x, 19x এবং 7x টাকা ছিলো। R যখন Q কে 200 taka দেয়, তখন P, Q এবং R এর টাকার পরিমাণ হয় যথাক্রমে 6x, 20x এবং 6x. এখন, Q এর টাকার পরিমাণ 19x থেকে বেড়ে 20x হয়। Therefore, 20x19x = 200 or x = 200. Therefore, total amount = 6x + 19x + 7x = 32x = 32 x 200 = 6,400.

questions.question: A lady went shopping and bought one red bag and 15 black bags. The cost of the red bag was 3 times the average cost of a black bag. If she had spent a total of Taka x for the bags, what was the cost of the red bag (in terms of x)
questions.explanation: মনে করি, average এ প্রতিটি black bag এর দাম 'b' taka. অতএব, প্রতিটি red bag এর দাম '3b' taka. According to the question, 3b + 15b = x ⇒ b = x/18 ∴ \therefore ∴ 3b = x/6

questions.question: A company has 3,600 employees of which 1/3 are clerks. If the clerical staff is reduced by 1/3, what percent of the total number of remaining employees would be clerical staff?
questions.explanation: 3600 টি employee এর মাঝে 1/3 clerk. So, number of clerks = 1200. Clerk এর সংখ্যা 1/3 বা 1200*1/3 = 400 কমানোর পরে, Number of clerks = 1200-400 = 800, and Number of employees = 3600-400 = 3200 [Clerk এর সংখ্যা কমালে Employee এর সংখ্যাও কমতে হবে] Therefore, percentage of clerks = 800/3200 x 100 = 25%

questions.question: If a positive integer is selected randomly and is divided by 7, what is the probability that the remainder is greater than 0 and NOT an even number?
questions.explanation: To meet the given condition, the remainders can be 1,3 or 5 . Out of every 7 integers, there are 3 integers, which if divided by 7 leave a remainder of 1 or 3 or 5 . For example, from 8 to 14 , dividing 8 , 10,12 will leave remainders of 1,3 and 5 respectively. The general format can be expressed as 7 n + 1 , 7 n + 3 7 n+1,7 n+3 7 n + 1 , 7 n + 3 , and 7 n + 5 7 n+5 7 n + 5 . Starting from 1 all the way to infinity, we can divide the numbers into groups of 7 positive integers. Here, 3 positive integers will meet the desired condition. So, probability = 3 / 7 =3 / 7 = 3/7 .

questions.question: Some statisticians claim that the surest way to increase the overall correctness of the total set of one's beliefs is: never change that set, except by rejecting a belief when given adequate evidence against it. However, if this were the only rule one followed, then whenever one were presented with any kind of evidence, one would have to either reject some of one's beliefs or else leave one's beliefs unchanged. But then, over time, one could only have fewer and fewer beliefs. Since we need many beliefs in order to survive, the statisticians' claim must be mistaken. The argument is most vulnerable to criticism on the grounds that it

options.label: ক
options.text: presumes, without providing any justification, that the surest way of increasing the overall correctness of the total set of one's beliefs must not hinder one's ability to survive

options.label: খ
options.text: neglects the possibility that even while following the statisticians' rule, one might also accept new beliefs when presented with some kinds of evidence

options.label: গ
options.text: overlooks the possibility that some large sets of beliefs are more correct overall than are some small sets of beliefs

options.label: ঘ
options.text: takes for granted that one should accept some beliefs related to survival even when given adequate evidence against them

questions.option_a: presumes, without providing any justification, that the surest way of increasing the overall correctness of the total set of one's beliefs must not hinder one's ability to survive
questions.option_b: neglects the possibility that even while following the statisticians' rule, one might also accept new beliefs when presented with some kinds of evidence
questions.option_c: overlooks the possibility that some large sets of beliefs are more correct overall than are some small sets of beliefs
questions.option_d: takes for granted that one should accept some beliefs related to survival even when given adequate evidence against them
questions.explanation: The passage first presents a claim that some statisticians make: "The surest way to increase the overall correctness of the total set of one's beliefs is: never change that set, except by rejecting a belief when given adequate evidence against it" (in other words, "don't add any beliefs; rather, only remove beliefs when given adequate evidence against them). The author then prefaces the argument with, "If this were the only rule one followed.." (And that rule is, "never change that set, except by rejecting a belief when given adequate evidence against it."). Therefore, the author's argument is only concerned with what would happen if that were the only rule one followed (i.e. if one were to only remove beliefs and never add new beliefs). If someone were to "accept new beliefs when presented with some kinds of evidence" (as stated in choice B), then that person would NOT be adhering only to that rule (since they would be ADDING to the set of beliefs). So, the author does not neglect the "possibility that even while following the statisticians' rule, one might also accept new beliefs when presented with some kinds of evidence"; rather, the author specifically states that the argument does not apply in those situations. Thus, B can be eliminated.

questions.explanation: 'Mimic the reasoning' questions are a bit harder than others. You first need to figure out the reasoning of the argument and then try to figure out the logic used in each of the options. It helps to put the logic in A and B format. Jordan: If a business invests the money necessary to implement ecologically sound practices, its market share will decrease. But if it doesn't implement these practices, it pollutes the environment and wastes resources. Jordan: If A does X, something bad will happen to A. If A doesn't do X, something bad will happen to B. Terry: But if consumers demand environmental responsibility of all businesses, no particular business will be especially hurt. Terry: If C does D, A doing X will not be bad. Now this is the logic used by the argument: Jordan: If A does X, something bad will happen to A. If A doesn't do X, something bad will happen to B. Terry: If C does Y, A doing X will not be bad. (A) Jordan: Either it will rain and our plans for a picnic will be thwarted, or it won't rain and the garden will go yet another day without much-needed watering. Terry: But if it doesn't rain, we can buy a hose and water the garden with the hose. Jordan: If it rains, something bad will happen to us. If it doesn't rain something bad will happen to garden. Terry: If we do X, raining will not be bad. That logic does parallel our original logic. (B) Jordan: Each person can have either an enjoyable life or a long life, for one must eat vegetables and exercise continuously to stay healthy. Terry: That's not true: there are many happy health- conscious people. Jordan: One can get only one thing at a time A or B. Terry: No, both can be had together. (C) Jordan: If taxes are raised, many social problems could be solved, but if they're lowered, the economy will grow again. So, we can't have both social reform and a growing economy. Terry: But if taxes remain at their current level, neither social problems nor the economy will get worse. Jordan: If A does X, good things will happen. If A does opposite of X, other good things will happen. So, both good things cannot happen simultaneously. Terry: If nothing is done, no bad thing will happen. (D) Jordan: If we remodel the kitchen, the house will be more valuable, but even if we do, there's no guarantee that we'll actually get more for the house when we sell it. Terry: But if we don't remodel the kitchen, we might get even less for the house than we paid for it. Jordan: If we do X, a good thing will happen but no guarantee about another good thing. Terry: If we do not do X, a bad thing may happen. (E) Jordan: If the dam's spillway is opened, the river might flood the eastern part of town, but if the spillway is not opened, the dam might burst. Terry: There's no real danger of the dam's bursting, but if we get more heavy rain, opening the spillway is the most prudent policy. Jordan: If X happens, a bad thing may happen but if X doesn't happen, another bad thing may happen. Terry: Chances of the other bad thing are low. Doing X may be most prudent. So, the area of the photograph will be equal to the product of length and breadth, i.e., 10 × 8 10 \times 8 10 × 8 which will be equal to 80 squareinches. If we need to find the area of the photograph with border, then we have add 2 x 2 x 2 x in the length and breadth of the photograph, because the width has to be considered for both sides. So, the length of the photograph with the border will be 10 + 2 x 10+2 x 10 + 2 x and the breadth of the photograph with the border will be 8 + 2 x 8+2 x 8 + 2 x Therefore, the area of photograph with border will be product of length and breadth, i.e., ( 10 + 2 x ) ( 8 + 2 x ) (10+2 x)(8+2 x) ( 10 + 2 x ) ( 8 + 2 x ) which will be equal to ( 10 + 2 x ) ( 8 + 2 x ) = 80 + 20 x + 16 x + 4 x 2 = 4 x 2 + 36 x + 80 (10+2 x)(8+2 x)=80+20 x+16 x+4 x^{2}=4 x^{2}+36 x+80 ( 10 + 2 x ) ( 8 + 2 x ) = 80 + 20 x + 16 x + 4 x 2 = 4 x 2 + 36 x + 80 Again, it is given in the question that the area of the border is 144 square inches. To find the area of the border we need to subtract the area of the photograph with a photograph with border. Therefore, Area of photograph with border - Area of photograph = 144 =144 = 144 Now, 4 x 2 + 36 x + 80 − 80 = 144 4 x^{2}+36 x+80-80=144 4 x 2 + 36 x + 80 − 80 = 144 Which gives us x = 3 \mathrm{x}=3 x = 3

questions.question: Instructions: DO NOT USE CALCULATOR. Figures are not drawn to scale. If x, y and z are positive integers such that when x is divided by y, the remainder is z and when x is divided by z, the remainder is (y-2), then which of the following must be true?

options.label: খ
options.text: x + z is divisible by y

questions.option_b: x + z is divisible by y
questions.explanation: (A) When x is divided by y, the remainder is z. This means that y > z. Again, when x is divided by z, the remainder is y-2. So, z > y-2, or, z+2 > y. Combining both of these inequalities, z+2 > y > z. Now, x, y and z are all positive integers. y is an integer which is greater than z but smaller than z+2. So, y has to be equal to z+1 to satisfy the conditions. So, y = z+1, or, z = y-1. Answer is (A).

questions.question: During the late 1920s and early 1930s, the Communist Party in many countries adopted a strategy known as the Third Period , characterized by a highly radical stance. Party leaders emphasized the imminent collapse of capitalism and the need for an immediate workers’ revolution. They were often critical of social democrats and liberal organizations, labeling them as obstacles to true socialist transformation. By the mid-1930s, however, the global political context shifted with the rise of fascism in Europe. In response, Communist Parties adopted the Popular Front strategy, seeking alliances with a broader spectrum of political and social groups, including liberals, trade unionists, and anti-fascist organizations. The focus during the Popular Front era was less on immediate revolutionary action and more on building coalitions, gradual reforms, and united resistance against fascist threats. The contrast between the Third Period and the Popular Front illustrates how political strategies may shift dramatically in response to changing social and international conditions, from radical confrontation to cooperative engagement. Based on the passage, which one of the following statements is more likely to have been made by a Communist Party organizer during the Third Period than during the Popular Front?

options.label: ক

options.label: খ

options.label: গ
options.text: African Americans should strive to overcome racism in the highest levels of government.

options.label: ঘ
options.text: The goals of communism have much in common with those of more liberal causes.

questions.explanation: Explanation: Third Period (1928–1935): Communist parties pursued a radical, revolutionary line . Saw social democrats, liberals, and non-communists as enemies. Emphasized immediate workers’ revolution . Popular Front (mid-1930s onward): Communist parties worked with broader coalitions (liberals, anti-fascists). Focus on gradual reforms and alliances. African Americans and whites must join together under communism → Popular Front style (coalition) ❌ Workers everywhere must revolt to bring about the final global victory over capitalist oppression → Radical revolutionary rhetoric → Third Period style ✅ African Americans should strive to overcome racism in government → reformist / coalition → Popular Front ❌ Communism aligns with liberal causes → Popular Front ❌ Don’t expect too much progress too quickly → reformist / gradualism → Popular Front ❌ Correct Option: খ — Workers everywhere must revolt to bring about the final global victory over capitalist oppression

questions.explanation: Option Analysis: ক. It had analyzed ❌ “It” would refer to the dataset. Datasets don’t analyze themselves → grammatically wrong. খ. is analyzed ✅ Passive voice, present tense. Correct because the dataset is being acted upon , not doing the action. Fits formal/scientific context. গ. they analyzed ❌ Active voice, past tense. Could work if rewritten : “They analyzed it…” In the current sentence, grammatically it doesn’t fit after “which” because “which” refers to the dataset (object). ঘ. they had analyzed ❌ Past perfect, active voice. Same issue as above, and tense is unnecessary. ঙ. It has analyzed ❌ Active voice, present perfect. Dataset cannot analyze itself → incorrect. ✅ Correct Answer: খ — is analyzed

questions.question: Instructions: Answer the Questions based on the following article. Much of the information we have today about chimpanzees comes from the groundbreaking, long-term research of the great conservationist, Jane Goodall. Jane Goodall was born in London, England, on April 3, 1934. From an early age, Jane was fascinated by animals and animal stories. By the age of 10, she was talking about going to Africa! At the time, in the early 1940s, this was a radical idea because women did not go to Africa by themselves. When in school, a friend invited her to visit Kenya. She worked as a waitress until she had earned the fare to travel there by boat. She was 23 years old. Once in Kenya, she met Dr. Louis Leakey, a famous paleontologist and anthropologist. He was impressed with her thorough knowledge of Africa and its wildlife, and hired her to assist him on a fossil- hunting expedition to Olduvai Gorge. Later, Dr. Leakey and Jane began planning a study of a group of chimpanzees who were living on the shores of Lake Tanganyika in Kenya. In July of 1960, Jane arrived at Gombe National Park in what was then called Tanganyika and is now called Tanzania. Jane expressed her interest in the idea of studying animals by living in the wild with them, rather than studying dead animals through paleontology. She had to face many challenges as she began her work. The chimpanzees did not accept her right away, and it took months for them to get used to her presence in their territory. But she was very patient and remained focused on her goal. Little by little, she was able to enter their world. At first, she was able to watch the chimpanzees only from a great distance, using binoculars. As time passed, she was able to move her observation point closer to them while still using camouflage. Eventually, she was able to sit among them, touching, patting, and even feeding them. It was an amazing accomplishment for Jane, and a breakthrough in the study of animals in the wild. Jane named all of the chimpanzees that she studied; stating in her journals that she felt they each had a unique personality. The study started by Jane Goodall in 1960 is now the longest field study of any animal species in their natural habitat. Research continues to this day in Gombe and is conducted by a team of trained Tanzanians. The main objective of the passage is to:

options.label: ক
options.text: Describe some important events of Jane's life.

options.label: খ
options.text: Describe the challenges she faced while conducting her study in Kenya.

options.label: গ
options.text: Highlight the major aspects and importance of Jane's study and research on chimpanzees.

options.label: ঘ
options.text: Explain how she overcame her challenges in life.

questions.question: Instructions: Answer the Questions based on the following article. Much of the information we have today about chimpanzees comes from the groundbreaking, long-term research of the great conservationist, Jane Goodall. Jane Goodall was born in London, England, on April 3, 1934. From an early age, Jane was fascinated by animals and animal stories. By the age of 10, she was talking about going to Africa! At the time, in the early 1940s, this was a radical idea because women did not go to Africa by themselves. When in school, a friend invited her to visit Kenya. She worked as a waitress until she had earned the fare to travel there by boat. She was 23 years old. Once in Kenya, she met Dr. Louis Leakey, a famous paleontologist and anthropologist. He was impressed with her thorough knowledge of Africa and its wildlife, and hired her to assist him on a fossil- hunting expedition to Olduvai Gorge. Later, Dr. Leakey and Jane began planning a study of a group of chimpanzees who were living on the shores of Lake Tanganyika in Kenya. In July of 1960, Jane arrived at Gombe National Park in what was then called Tanganyika and is now called Tanzania. Jane expressed her interest in the idea of studying animals by living in the wild with them, rather than studying dead animals through paleontology. She had to face many challenges as she began her work. The chimpanzees did not accept her right away, and it took months for them to get used to her presence in their territory. But she was very patient and remained focused on her goal. Little by little, she was able to enter their world. At first, she was able to watch the chimpanzees only from a great distance, using binoculars. As time passed, she was able to move her observation point closer to them while still using camouflage. Eventually, she was able to sit among them, touching, patting, and even feeding them. It was an amazing accomplishment for Jane, and a breakthrough in the study of animals in the wild. Jane named all of the chimpanzees that she studied; stating in her journals that she felt they each had a unique personality. The study started by Jane Goodall in 1960 is now the longest field study of any animal species in their natural habitat. Research continues to this day in Gombe and is conducted by a team of trained Tanzanians. What mainly made Jane's work different from those of others is:

options.label: ক
options.text: She wanted to observe and live with the wild animals in their natural habitat.

options.label: খ
options.text: She caressed and fed the animals.

options.label: গ
options.text: She was really passionate about her work.

questions.option_a: She wanted to observe and live with the wild animals in their natural habitat.
questions.option_b: She caressed and fed the animals.
questions.option_c: She was really passionate about her work.
questions.explanation: (A) "Jane expressed her interest in the idea of studying animals by living in the wild with them, rather than studying dead animals through paleontology.": This indicates that the typical way to study was through paleontology and not by living amongst the chimpanzees like Jane did.

The following restrictions must be observed: J must be performed on the second day. P must be performed in the morning. K and M must be performed at the same time. questions.question: A company sells packages of decorative papers, each containing three sheets of paper. The available colors are: red, orange, green, blue, and purple. Each package must conform to the following rules: Each package must contain sheets of either two or three different colors. A package containing any orange sheet must also contain at least one red sheet. A package containing any red sheet must also contain at least one orange sheet. Blue and purple sheets cannot be packed in the same package. A package containing any green sheet must also contain at least one purple sheet, but a package containing purple sheet need not contain green sheet. An acceptable package CANNOT contain two sheets of-
questions.explanation: Each package must contain sheets of either two or three different colors. ✅ Orange ↔ Red dependency: Any orange sheet ⇒ at least one red sheet. Any red sheet ⇒ at least one orange sheet. So, red and orange must appear together if either is included. Blue and purple sheets cannot be together. ❌ Green → Purple dependency: Any green sheet ⇒ at least one purple sheet. Purple sheet does not require green. Now, the question asks: “An acceptable package CANNOT contain two sheets of–” We need to check which color cannot have two sheets in the same package . Red & Orange: Must appear together if included, but nothing prohibits having two reds or two oranges . ✅ Possible. Blue & Purple: Cannot be together; two of the same color is not prohibited. ✅ Possible. Green & Purple: Green requires purple, but nothing prohibits two greens . ✅ Possible. The trick is with orange and red : since red ↔ orange dependency exists, having two oranges but no red would violate the rule. Similarly, two reds but no orange would also violate the rule. Thus, you cannot have two sheets of Orange or Red alone . ✅ The best answer from the options is: ক – Orange .

questions.question: Zubin is a high school music teacher who teaches in classes VIII to XII. From all his students, he has found seven to be exceptionally talented, and believes that if groomed properly, they will be big stars someday. He summarized the scheduling constraints as follows; Zakir's lesson must be on the day immediately before the day of Zofen's lesson. questions.explanation: Zakir আর Zofen as late as possible বসলে ওরা বসবে Wednesday আর Thursday তে। আবার joint class গুলা নিতে হচ্ছে Sunday আর Tuesday তে। Monday তে বসছে Muhit, এদিকে Sunday তে Bobby আর Tuesday তে Sabbir বসছে। তাই bappy কে class করতে হবে Bobby/Sabbir এর সাথে। Bobby is not in the options, so correct answer is Sabbir.

questions.question: Some statisticians claim that the surest way to increase the overall correctness of the total set of one's beliefs is: never change that set, except by rejecting a belief when given adequate evidence against it. However, if this were the only rule one followed, then whenever one were presented with any kind of evidence, one would have to either reject some of one's beliefs or else leave one's beliefs unchanged. But then, over time, one could only have fewer and fewer beliefs. Since we need many beliefs in order to survive, the statisticians' claim must be mistaken. The argument is most vulnerable to criticism on the grounds that it

options.label: ক
options.text: presumes, without providing any justification, that the surest way of increasing the overall correctness of the total set of one's beliefs must not hinder one's ability to survive

options.label: খ
options.text: neglects the possibility that even while following the statisticians' rule, one might also accept new beliefs when presented with some kinds of evidence

options.label: গ
options.text: overlooks the possibility that some large sets of beliefs are more correct overall than are some small sets of beliefs

options.label: ঘ
options.text: takes for granted that one should accept some beliefs related to survival even when given adequate evidence against them

questions.option_a: presumes, without providing any justification, that the surest way of increasing the overall correctness of the total set of one's beliefs must not hinder one's ability to survive
questions.option_b: neglects the possibility that even while following the statisticians' rule, one might also accept new beliefs when presented with some kinds of evidence
questions.option_c: overlooks the possibility that some large sets of beliefs are more correct overall than are some small sets of beliefs
questions.option_d: takes for granted that one should accept some beliefs related to survival even when given adequate evidence against them
questions.explanation: The passage first presents a claim that some statisticians make: "The surest way to increase the overall correctness of the total set of one's beliefs is: never change that set, except by rejecting a belief when given adequate evidence against it" (in other words, "don't add any beliefs; rather, only remove beliefs when given adequate evidence against them). The author then prefaces the argument with, "If this were the only rule one followed.." (And that rule is, "never change that set, except by rejecting a belief when given adequate evidence against it."). Therefore, the author's argument is only concerned with what would happen if that were the only rule one followed (i.e. if one were to only remove beliefs and never add new beliefs). If someone were to "accept new beliefs when presented with some kinds of evidence" (as stated in choice B), then that person would NOT be adhering only to that rule (since they would be ADDING to the set of beliefs). So, the author does not neglect the "possibility that even while following the statisticians' rule, one might also accept new beliefs when presented with some kinds of evidence"; rather, the author specifically states that the argument does not apply in those situations. Thus, B can be eliminated.

questions.explanation: ১৫ জন Senior executives এর মধ্যে মাত্র ১ জন মহিলা এবং ৩০ জন junior executives এর মধ্যে মাত্র ৫ জন্য মহিলা থাকার কারনে Rainbow Company কে gender discrimination এর অভিযোগে চিহ্নিত করা হয়েছে। প্রশ্ন হচ্ছে- answer choice এর মধ্যে কোনটি Rainbow এর পক্ষে এবং এই অভিযোগের বিপক্ষে বলা যায়। a) এটি অভিযোগের পক্ষে চলে যায়। b) Salary এর সাথে অভিযোগটির সম্পর্ক নেই। c) শুধু বিবাহিত মহিলারা অভিযোগটির সাথে সম্পৃক্ত নয়। d) দশগুণ বেশি পুরুষ আবেদন করলেও তাদের যোগ্যতা সম্পর্কে কিছু বলা হয়নি। e) এই answer choice টি তে নির্বাচন প্রক্রিয়ার স্বচ্ছতা তুলে ধরা হয়েছে এবং যোগ্যতার ভিত্তিতে employee selection এর কথা বলা হয়েছে, লিঙ্গ এখানে কোন ব্যাপার নয়। এটিই সবচেয়ে জোরালো যুক্তি।

questions.question: In mammals it is the secondary palate that permits breathing while eating. Clearly, breathing while eating is necessary to maintain the high rate of metabolism of mammals. The author's assertion would be most weakened by the discovery of a mammalian species that had a

options.label: ক
options.text: high rate of metabolism and the ability to breathe while eating

options.label: খ
options.text: low rate of metabolism and the ability to breathe while eating

options.label: গ
options.text: low rate of metabolism and no ability to breathe while eating

options.label: ঘ
options.text: high rate of metabolism and no secondary palate

questions.option_a: high rate of metabolism and the ability to breathe while eating
questions.option_b: low rate of metabolism and the ability to breathe while eating
questions.option_c: low rate of metabolism and no ability to breathe while eating
questions.option_d: high rate of metabolism and no secondary palate
questions.explanation: যেহেতু বলা আছে যে secondary palate এর জন্যই breathing while eating সম্ভব এবং high rate of metabolism এর জন্য breathing while eating necessary, যদি আমরা এম কোনো species পাই যার secondary palate নেই (অর্থাৎ breathing while eating পারেনা) তারপরেও high rate of metabolism আছে, তাহলেই তাঁর প্রথম conclusion কে weaken করা হয়।

questions.question: Read the following passage and select the best answer for each of the questions of that follow. National character is not formally considered by social scientists in discussing economic and social development today. They believe that people differ, and that these difference should be taken into account somehow, but they have as yet discovered no way to include such variables in their formal models of economic and social development. The difficulty lies in the nature of the data that supposedly define different national characteristics. Anthropologists and others are on much firmer ground when they attempt to describe the cultural norms for a small homogeneous tribe or village than when they undertake the formidable task of discovering the norms that exist in a complex modern nation-state composed of many disparate groups. The situation is further complicated by the nature of judgments about characters since such judgments are overly dependent on impressions, and since, furthermore, impressions are usually stated in qualitative terms, it is impossible to make a reliable comparison between the national characters of two countries. Which of the following best describes the organization of the passage?

options.label: ক
options.text: A problem is presented and reasons for its existence are supplied.

options.label: খ
options.text: A controversial view is presented and evidence for its validity is supplied.

options.label: গ
options.text: A hypothesis is presented and possible means of verifying it are suggested.

options.label: ঘ
options.text: Recent development is described and then analyzed.

questions.option_a: A problem is presented and reasons for its existence are supplied.
questions.option_b: A controversial view is presented and evidence for its validity is supplied.
questions.option_c: A hypothesis is presented and possible means of verifying it are suggested.
questions.option_d: Recent development is described and then analyzed.
questions.explanation: শুরুতে Social এবং Economic model-এ Nation character use করার Problem এবং পরবর্তীতে Problem এর কারন ব্যাখ্যা করা হয়েছে।

questions.question: The number of people diagnosed with Chikungunya fever (which is contracted from the bite of an infected mosquito) in Dhaka this month is twice the number diagnosed last month. The authorities have concluded that measures to control the mosquito population have failed in this city. All of the following, if true, would cast doubt on the authority's conclusion except -

options.label: ক
options.text: more cases are now reported because of increases in administrative efficiency

options.label: খ
options.text: a very high proportion of the cases were in people who had recently returned from neighboring cities

options.label: গ
options.text: an effective diagnostic test was introduced about two months ago

options.label: ঘ
options.text: the disease is prevalent only in some industrialized cities which have shown a dramatic increase in population due to migration

questions.option_a: more cases are now reported because of increases in administrative efficiency
questions.option_b: a very high proportion of the cases were in people who had recently returned from neighboring cities
questions.option_c: an effective diagnostic test was introduced about two months ago
questions.option_d: the disease is prevalent only in some industrialized cities which have shown a dramatic increase in population due to migration
questions.explanation: Analyze options: More cases reported due to administrative efficiency → suggests the increase may be apparent, not real → casts doubt ✅ Many cases in people recently returned from neighboring cities → increase may be due to imported cases → casts doubt ✅ Effective diagnostic test introduced two months ago → increase may be due to better detection, not real increase → casts doubt ✅ Disease prevalent in industrialized cities with population growth due to migration → could explain increase → casts doubt ✅ Incidence of dengue has increased → unrelated to Chikungunya; does not cast doubt ❌ Correct Option (does NOT cast doubt): ঙ — the incidence (number of cases per thousand) of dengue, also contracted from mosquito bites, has increased

questions.question: Viewership of ABC News, a Bangladeshi news channel, dropped significantly after controversial news on the Share market of Bangladesh was aired last month. ABC News received a substantial number of complaints from its viewers. However, the CEO of this channel claims that the adverse reaction from the report had no relation to the decline in ABC News Channel's viewership. Which of the following, if true, strongly justifies the CEO's claim?

options.label: ক
options.text: ABC news received most of the complaints from its regular viewers.

options.label: খ
options.text: Many people consider news channel's report a credible source of information about the Share market

options.label: গ
options.text: The other Bangladeshi news channels experienced similar drop in viewership.

options.label: ঘ
options.text: Most of the large news channels publicly attribute reduction in viewership to their own reports only when they receive complaints about those reports.

questions.option_a: ABC news received most of the complaints from its regular viewers.
questions.option_b: Many people consider news channel's report a credible source of information about the Share market
questions.option_c: The other Bangladeshi news channels experienced similar drop in viewership.
questions.option_d: Most of the large news channels publicly attribute reduction in viewership to their own reports only when they receive complaints about those reports.
questions.explanation: Explanation: Claim by CEO: The drop in viewership is unrelated to the controversial report. Question: Which statement supports the CEO’s claim (justifies that the report did not cause the drop)? Analyze options: ABC news received most complaints from regular viewers → irrelevant to viewership drop among general audience ❌ Many people consider ABC credible for Share market news → credibility may mitigate impact, but doesn’t directly justify drop is unrelated ❌ Other Bangladeshi news channels experienced similar drop in viewership → suggests the drop was industry-wide , not specific to ABC News → strongly supports CEO’s claim ✅ Large channels attribute drop to their reports only when complaints received → irrelevant to ABC’s viewership decline ❌ ABC had broadcast controversial news before that caused complaints → may suggest a pattern, could even weaken CEO’s claim ❌

questions.question: One day, a poet was requested to interpret an especially peculiar and obscure passage from one of his own poems. His response was "at the time that I was writing that particular verse, only God and myself knew its meaning. Now, it is only God who knows." What did the poet mean by his answer?

options.label: ক
options.text: God is much wiser than people are

options.label: গ
options.text: Poets don't often know where their creative inspiration comes from

options.label: ঘ
options.text: The poet has forgotten the meaning of his own verse

questions.option_a: God is much wiser than people are
questions.option_c: Poets don't often know where their creative inspiration comes from
questions.option_d: The poet has forgotten the meaning of his own verse
questions.explanation: The poet humorously couches the fact that he forgot what he meant by saying only he and God knew at the time, and now only God knows-i.e., now he himself does not know.

questions.question: A newspaper advertisement reads as follows: "Never again will you have to pay high prices for imported spring water. It is now bottled locally and inexpensively. You'll never taste the difference, however, if you're likely to be embarrassed to serve domestic spring water, simply serve it in a leaded crystal bottle." What is the assumption made by this advertisement?

options.label: ক
options.text: It's not hard to tell domestic water from imported water based on its flavor

options.label: খ
options.text: The majority of spring water is bottled at its source

options.label: গ
options.text: Restrictions on importing and customs duties make the price of imported water higher

options.label: ঘ
options.text: Spring water tastes best when it's served from a decanter

questions.option_a: It's not hard to tell domestic water from imported water based on its flavor
questions.option_b: The majority of spring water is bottled at its source
questions.option_c: Restrictions on importing and customs duties make the price of imported water higher
questions.option_d: Spring water tastes best when it's served from a decanter
questions.explanation: The ad assumes some people find imported spring water a status symbol by mentioning their embarrassment over serving domestic.

questions.question: In city A, a greater number of newspapers is sold than in city B. Therefore, citizens of city A are better informed about major world events that are the citizens of City B. All of the following weakens the above statement except?

options.label: ক
options.text: City A has a larger population than City B

options.label: খ
options.text: Most citizens of City B works in City A and buys their newspaper from there.

options.label: গ
options.text: Average time citizens spend on reading newspaper is higher in City A

options.label: ঘ
options.text: Average price of newspaper in City A is higher than in City B.

questions.option_a: City A has a larger population than City B
questions.option_b: Most citizens of City B works in City A and buys their newspaper from there.
questions.option_c: Average time citizens spend on reading newspaper is higher in City A
questions.option_d: Average price of newspaper in City A is higher than in City B.
questions.explanation: যেহেতু city A তে city B এর তুলনায় বেশি newspaper বিক্রি হয়, সেহেতু city A এর লোকজন city B এর তুলনায় major world events সম্পর্কে বেশী অবহিত। এই যুক্তিতে দুর্বল করেনা এমন একটি statement হচ্ছে C কারন C তে বলা হচ্ছে city A এর লোকজন বেশি সময় ধরে newspaper পড়ে। এতে করে প্রদত্ত যুক্তিতে দুর্বল করা যায় না।

questions.question: "Fifty percent of our products are sold in rural area, fifty-eight percent are sold in semi-urban area, sixty-five percent of the employees are from rural area." is the statement of a FMCG producer. Which of the following statements can be considered true based on the above?
