questions.question: Ergot is a fungus that can infest the seed heads of any grain crop but is common only on rye. Ergot contains chemicals poisonous to humans. Rye was introduced in Europe in the Middle Ages as a crop for land too poor and damp for wheat to grow well. Thus, rye tended to be the staple of the poorer peasants. Which of the following hypotheses is best supported by the information above?

options.label: ক
options.text: Ergot did not occur in Europe prior to the Middle Ages,

options.label: খ
options.text: People in the Middle Ages were well aware of the toxicity of ergot.

options.label: গ
options.text: Before the introduction of rye, no attempts had been made to cultivate the poor and damp land in Europe.

options.label: ঘ
options.text: in Europe during the Middle Ages, prosperous people were less at risk from ergot poisoningthan poor people were.

questions.option_a: Ergot did not occur in Europe prior to the Middle Ages,
questions.option_b: People in the Middle Ages were well aware of the toxicity of ergot.
questions.option_c: Before the introduction of rye, no attempts had been made to cultivate the poor and damp land in Europe.
questions.option_d: in Europe during the Middle Ages, prosperous people were less at risk from ergot poisoningthan poor people were.
questions.explanation: (D) As it was more eaten by people who were poor, thus they were more at risk

questions.question: Leaders of a garments' union in Bangladesh on a strike against their garments company "KIRTONKHOLA" are contemplating additional measures to pressure the company to accept the union's contract proposal. The union leaders are considering as their principal new tactic, a consumer boycott against "BHUBONESHSHOR", a customarized super shop outlet, which is owned by "RIVERINE BANGLADESH", the same group that owns "KIRTONKHOLA". Answer to which of the following questions is LEAST directly relevant to the union leaders' consideration of whether attempting a boycott of "BHUBONESHSHOR" will lead to acceptance of their contract proposal?

options.label: ক
options.text: Would revenue losses by "BHUBONESHSHOR" seriously affect "RIVERINE BANGLADESH"?

options.label: খ
options.text: Can current "BHUBONESHSHOR" customers easily shop elsewhere?

options.label: গ
options.text: Have other unions that have employed a similar tactic achieved their goals with it?

options.label: ঘ
options.text: Do other corporations that own garment companies also own customarized super shop outlets.

questions.option_a: Would revenue losses by "BHUBONESHSHOR" seriously affect "RIVERINE BANGLADESH"?
questions.option_b: Can current "BHUBONESHSHOR" customers easily shop elsewhere?
questions.option_c: Have other unions that have employed a similar tactic achieved their goals with it?
questions.option_d: Do other corporations that own garment companies also own customarized super shop outlets.
questions.explanation: Question stem টি-মনোযোগ দিয়ে পড়লে যা বোঝা যায় তা হচ্ছে- KIRTONKHLA garments এর শ্রমিক ইউনিয়ন কর্তৃপক্ষের বিরুদ্ধে তাদের অসহযোগিতা বাড়ানোর পরিকল্পনা করছে। এর অংশ হিসেবে তারা BHUBONESHSHOR নামের দোকান থেকে কিছু না কেনার সিদ্ধান্ত নিয়েছে। দোকনটি এবং garments-এ দু'য়েরই মালিক RIVERINE BANGLADESH. অর্থাৎ তারা strike এর পাশাপাশি ভিন্ন দৃষ্টিকোন থেকে মালিকপক্ষকে ক্ষতিগ্রস্ত করে দাবী আদায়ের পথ সুগম করতে চাইছে। Answer choices এ কয়েকটি প্রশ্ন দেয়া আগে এবং জানতে চাওয়া হয়েছে কোন প্রশ্নের উত্তর জানাটি ইউনিয়নের নতুন plan কার্যকরী করার জন্য সবচেয়ে কম প্রাসঙ্গিক। a) অবশ্যই প্রাসঙ্গিক; কারন তারা Riverine কেই চাপে ফেলতে চাইছে। b) এটিও প্রাসঙ্গিক; বিকল্প দোকান না থাকলে তাদের plan কার্যকরী হবেনা। c) এটিও মোটামুটি প্রাসঙ্গিক; আগে অন্য কেউ এ ধরনের strategy-তে সাফল্য লাভ করেছে কিনা তা জানা important. d) অন্য garments এর এ রকম দোকান আছে কিনা সেটা জানা না জানার উপর কিছুই নির্ভর করেনা, এটি মোটামুটি অপ্রাসঙ্গিক।

questions.question: A dog hears higher pitches than what a human hears; a cat has a greater capacity to see in dim light than a human normally has; a platypus picks up weak electric signals to which a human is normally insensitive. Which of the following conclusions can be properly drawn from the statements above?

options.label: ক
options.text: Most animals have sensory capacities superior to those demonstrated by humans.

options.label: খ
options.text: Some animals have sensory capacities that are different from those of humans.

options.label: গ
options.text: During evolution the eyes and ears of human beings were modified to make human sense perception less acute.

options.label: ঘ
options.text: Researchers should not be surprised to find that all the sensory capacities of platypuses aregreater than any of those demonstrated by humans.

questions.option_a: Most animals have sensory capacities superior to those demonstrated by humans.
questions.option_b: Some animals have sensory capacities that are different from those of humans.
questions.option_c: During evolution the eyes and ears of human beings were modified to make human sense perception less acute.
questions.option_d: Researchers should not be surprised to find that all the sensory capacities of platypuses aregreater than any of those demonstrated by humans.
questions.explanation: (E) Given from the last line of question

questions.question: In "RIGHT ON TIME" courier service, during an autumn day, a courier has to deliver six packages Hurricane, Torpedo, Cyclone, Tornado, Typhoon, and Thunder. He delivers no other packages, and no two packages are delivered at the same time. The order in which the packages are delivered conforms to the following conditions: Hurricane is neither delivered first nor delivered last. Cyclone is delivered before Tornado is delivered. Thunder is delivered after Tornado is delivered. Typhoon and Cyclone are delivered in immediate succession, regardless of whether Typhoon or Cyclone is delivered first. If Thunder is delivered before Hurricane, which of the following must be true?

options.label: ক
options.text: Cyclone is the first package delivered

options.label: খ
options.text: Typhoon is the first package delivered

options.label: গ
options.text: Tornado is delivered after Hurricane is delivered

options.label: ঘ
options.text: Hurricane is delivered after Torpedo is delivered

questions.option_a: Cyclone is the first package delivered
questions.option_b: Typhoon is the first package delivered
questions.option_c: Tornado is delivered after Hurricane is delivered
questions.option_d: Hurricane is delivered after Torpedo is delivered
questions.explanation: ছয়টি package (Hurricane, Torpedo, Cyclone, Tornado, Typhoon ও Thunder) deliver করতে হবে নিচের শর্তানুযায়ী- a. দু'টি package একসাথে deliver করা যাবেনা। b. Hurricane একদম প্রথমে বা একদম শেষে deliver করা যাবেনা। c. Cyclone এর delivery হবে Tornado এর আগে। d. Thunder এর delivery হবে Tornado এর পরে। e. Typhoon Cyclone এর delivery হতে হবে ঠিক আগে-পরে, মাঝখানে অন্য কোন delivery হবে না। অর্থাৎ Typhoon এর পরপর cyclone বা cyclone এর পরপর Typhoon deliver করতে হবে। Thunder এর আগে Torpedo (শর্ত-4) এবং Tornado এর আগে Cyclone ও Typhoon (শর্ত- 3 ও 5) এখন, ৩টি Thunder এর আগে হলে Thunder এর Position 4 এ রেখে Hurricane কে 5 এ রাখতে হবে। কারণ Hurricane শেষে deliver করা যাবেনা (শর্ত ২)। অর্থাৎ Sequence হবে 1 আর 2 এ Cyclone ও Typhoon, 3-এ Tornado, 4-এ Thunder, 5-এ Hurricane, 6-এ Torpedo.

questions.question: Which of the following, if true, would most strengthen the consumer groups claim?

options.label: ক
options.text: Consuming too much salt results in health problems, including heart diseases.

options.label: খ
options.text: Food without salt tastes much better.

options.label: গ
options.text: The salt in vegetables is very similar to table salt.

options.label: ঘ
options.text: Consumers are confused about the health benefits of rock and sea salts compared to table salt.

questions.option_a: Consuming too much salt results in health problems, including heart diseases.
questions.option_b: Food without salt tastes much better.

questions.option_d: Consumers are confused about the health benefits of rock and sea salts compared to table salt.

questions.question: The sense of delayed gratification of working now for later pleasure has helped shape the economic behavior of our society. However, that sense is no longer nurtured as consistently in our children as it once was. For example, it used to take a bit of patience to put together the toys that children got inside the cereal boxes; now the toys come in whole. Which of the following is an assumption made by the argument?

options.label: ক
options.text: The toys in cereal boxes have changed partly because the economic conditions of our society have improved.

options.label: খ
options.text: The influence of promotion gimmicks on the economic behavior of our society has increased over the years

options.label: গ
options.text: The toys that used to come in cereal boxes were put together by the same children who played with them.

options.label: ঘ
options.text: Part of the pleasure of any toy lies in putting the toy together before playing with it.

questions.option_a: The toys in cereal boxes have changed partly because the economic conditions of our society have improved.
questions.option_b: The influence of promotion gimmicks on the economic behavior of our society has increased over the years
questions.option_c: The toys that used to come in cereal boxes were put together by the same children who played with them.
questions.option_d: Part of the pleasure of any toy lies in putting the toy together before playing with it.
questions.explanation: এখানে একটি argument (প্রথম বাক্যটি) এর সাথে relevant অপর একটি argument (বাচ্চাদের খেলনার ব্যাপারটি) তুলনা করা হয়েছে। এখন কিছু একটা করে পরবর্তীতে ফল ভোগ করে (delayed pleasure) আনন্দ পাওয়ার কথা বলা হয়েছে। বলা হয়েছে, আগে খেলনার যন্ত্রাংশ জোড়া লাগিয়ে পুরো খেলনা বানাত বাচ্চারা; আর এখন খেলনাটা বানানো অবস্থাতেই আসে। অতএব প্রথম argument এর delayed pleasure এর ব্যাপারটি ওদের মধ্যে চর্চিত হচ্ছেনা। এখন, missing assumption খুঁজতে গিয়ে দেখুন-যারা খেলনার part গুলো জোড়া লাগাতো, সেই একই বাচ্চারা ঐ খেলনা দিয়ে খেলত-এটা assume না করলে argument টি দাঁড়ায়না।

questions.question: A group of six friends - Jack, Kimberly, Lee, Melissa, Nick Olivia - go out to eat at a restaurant. Which of the following statements, if true best explains the unexpected drop in yield.

options.text: Other farms that began using the experimental system at about he same time also reported an unexpected plummet in yields this year.

options.label: গ
options.text: The central California region where the farm in question is located experienced a drought 9 years ago, 3 years ago, and this past year.

options.label: ঘ
options.text: A different experimental system, used on a different crop, failed after two years at a farm in lowa. Scientists later discovered that chemicals involved in this different system slowly poisoned the soil.

questions.option_a: As a result of a serious and recent economic recession, the market for the products the farm produced shrank in size during the past year.
questions.option_b: Other farms that began using the experimental system at about he same time also reported an unexpected plummet in yields this year.
questions.option_c: The central California region where the farm in question is located experienced a drought 9 years ago, 3 years ago, and this past year.
questions.option_d: A different experimental system, used on a different crop, failed after two years at a farm in lowa. Scientists later discovered that chemicals involved in this different system slowly poisoned the soil.
questions.explanation: সবচেয়ে কাছের উত্তর D ও E। Option D তে একটি অন্য পরীক্ষামূলক ব্যাবস্থার কথা বলা হয়েছে যা প্রশ্নের সাথে প্রাসঙ্গিক না। Option E তে একটি যুক্তি দেখানো হয়েছে যা প্রশ্নের পরীক্ষামূলক ব্যাবস্থার সাথে ফসল কমার সম্পর্ক স্থাপন করে। Option ঙ directly links the previous consistent growth to a plausible cause for the current decline : nutrient exhaustion. Other options are less directly related: ক talks about market size, not yield. খ mentions other farms, but doesn’t explain why this particular farm’s yield dropped . গ mentions past droughts, but the drop this year needs a more direct explanation. ঘ refers to a different system on a different crop — not directly relevant.

questions.question: Jordan: If a business invests the money necessary to implement ecologically sound practices, its market share will decrease. But if it doesn't implement these practices, it pollutes the environment and wastes resources. Terry: But if consumers demand environmental responsibility of all businesses, no particular business will be especially hurt. In which one of the following exchanges is the logical relationship between Jordan's and Terry's statements most similar to the logical relationship between their statements above?

options.label: ক
options.text: Jordan: Either it will rain and our plans for a picnic will be thwarted or it won't rain and the garden will go yet another day without much-needed watering. Terry: But if it doesn't rain, we can buy a hose and water the garden with the hose.

options.label: খ
options.text: Jordan: Each person can have either an enjoyable life or a long life, for one must eat vegetables and exercise continuously to stay healthy. Terry: That's not true: there are many happy health-conscious people.

options.label: গ
options.text: Jordan: If taxes are raised, many social problems could be solved, but if they're lowered, the economy will grow again. So we can't have both social reform and a growing economy. Terry: But if taxes remain at their current level, neither social problems nor the economy will get worse.

options.label: ঘ
options.text: Jordan: If we remodel the kitchen, the house will be more valuable, but even if we do, there's no guarantee that we'll actually get more for the house when we sell it. Terry: But if we don't remodel the kitchen, we might get even less for the house than we paid for it.

questions.option_a: Jordan: Either it will rain and our plans for a picnic will be thwarted or it won't rain and the garden will go yet another day without much-needed watering. Terry: But if it doesn't rain, we can buy a hose and water the garden with the hose.
questions.option_b: Jordan: Each person can have either an enjoyable life or a long life, for one must eat vegetables and exercise continuously to stay healthy. Terry: That's not true: there are many happy health-conscious people.
questions.option_c: Jordan: If taxes are raised, many social problems could be solved, but if they're lowered, the economy will grow again. So we can't have both social reform and a growing economy. Terry: But if taxes remain at their current level, neither social problems nor the economy will get worse.
questions.option_d: Jordan: If we remodel the kitchen, the house will be more valuable, but even if we do, there's no guarantee that we'll actually get more for the house when we sell it. Terry: But if we don't remodel the kitchen, we might get even less for the house than we paid for it.
questions.explanation: 'Mimic the reasoning' questions are a bit harder than others. You first need to figure out the reasoning of the argument and then try to figure out the logic used in each of the options. It helps to put the logic in A and B format. Jordan: If a business invests the money necessary to implement ecologically sound practices, its market share will decrease. But if it doesn't implement these practices, it pollutes the environment and wastes resources. Jordan: If A does X, something bad will happen to A. If A doesn't do X, something bad will happen to B. Terry: But if consumers demand environmental responsibility of all businesses, no particular business will be especially hurt. Terry: If C does D, A doing X will not be bad. Now this is the logic used by the argument: Jordan: If A does X, something bad will happen to A. If A doesn't do X, something bad will happen to B. Terry: If C does Y, A doing X will not be bad. (A) Jordan: Either it will rain and our plans for a picnic will be thwarted, or it won't rain and the garden will go yet another day without much-needed watering. Terry: But if it doesn't rain, we can buy a hose and water the garden with the hose. Jordan: If it rains, something bad will happen to us. If it doesn't rain something bad will happen to garden. Terry: If we do X, raining will not be bad. That logic does parallel our original logic. (B) Jordan: Each person can have either an enjoyable life or a long life, for one must eat vegetables and exercise continuously to stay healthy. Terry: That's not true: there are many happy health- conscious people. Jordan: One can get only one thing at a time A or B. Terry: No, both can be had together. (C) Jordan: If taxes are raised, many social problems could be solved, but if they're lowered, the economy will grow again. So, we can't have both social reform and a growing economy. Terry: But if taxes remain at their current level, neither social problems nor the economy will get worse. Jordan: If A does X, good things will happen. If A does opposite of X, other good things will happen. So, both good things cannot happen simultaneously. Terry: If nothing is done, no bad thing will happen. (D) Jordan: If we remodel the kitchen, the house will be more valuable, but even if we do, there's no guarantee that we'll actually get more for the house when we sell it. Terry: But if we don't remodel the kitchen, we might get even less for the house than we paid for it. Jordan: If we do X, a good thing will happen but no guarantee about another good thing. Terry: If we do not do X, a bad thing may happen. (E) Jordan: If the dam's spillway is opened, the river might flood the eastern part of town, but if the spillway is not opened, the dam might burst. Terry: There's no real danger of the dam's bursting, but if we get more heavy rain, opening the spillway is the most prudent policy. Jordan: If X happens, a bad thing may happen but if X doesn't happen, another bad thing may happen. Terry: Chances of the other bad thing are low. Doing X may be most prudent. Hence the correct answer is A.

options.text: Rakshan is in a group with a senior.

options.label: ঘ
options.text: One of the groups includes no freshmen.

questions.option_b: One of the two seniors is in a group with Wajhat.

questions.explanation: গুরুত্বপূর্ণ তথ্যগুলো হচ্ছেঃ ৩ জন Sophomore (R, S, T), ২ জন Senior (U, V) এবং ৪ জন Freshmen (W, X, Y, Z) এই মোট ৯ জন এর কাছে খেলার ৯ টি টিকেট আছে। কিন্তু seat member গুলো আছে এমনভাবে যাতে তাদেরকে ৩টি ভিন্ন জায়গায় বসতে হয়। ঐ ৩টি ভিন্ন জায়গার প্রতিটিতে পাশাপাশি ৩ জন বসতে পারবে। এমতাবস্থায় এই ৯ জনকে কিছু শর্ত মাথায় রেখে ৩টি ৩জনের group-এ ভাগ হয়ে বসতে হবে। শর্তগুলো হচ্ছে: 1) Sophomores রা একজন আরেকজনের সাথে থাকবে না। 2) Senior রা একজন আরেকজনের সাথে থাকবে না। 3) W এবং R একসাথে থাকবে না। 4) X, S অথবা U এর সাথে থাকবে অথবা দুজনের সাথে একসাথে থাকবে। এবার প্রশ্নগুলো দেখা যাক। A, B, C, D কোনটিই অবশ্যম্ভাবী নয়। E অবশ্যই হতে হবে; কারন ৩ জন sophomore কে ৩টি আলাদা group এ রেখে এবং ২ জন senior কে ২টি আলাদা group এ রাখতে হলে অবশ্যই ১জন sophomore কে একটি group এ ২ জন freshmen এর সাথে থাকতে হবে

questions.question: New employees of Ramna Industries are complaining about discomfort caused by excessive noise inside Ramna's factory.
